metadata.synopsis: At camp, avatar Gale ponder the Crown of Karsus after it was seen with the elder brain in the colony.

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *You should get some rest, but you simply can't. Every time you close your eyes, you see the brain... and more importantly, what it possessed.*
1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale stands in a corner of the camp by himself, deep in thought (arms crossed, chin propped up in one hand)

5.speaker: Narrator
5.text: *An artefact. A crown. Positively reeking of Netherese magic. More than you ever felt before. More than you ever dreamed was possible.*

4.speaker: Narrator
4.text: *You must learn more. The book acquired from Sorcerous Sundries - it surely has the knowledge you need.*
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale gazes off to the middistance (at nothing in particular) with a resolved expression.

0.speaker: Narrator
0.text: *You must learn more. There was a book in Sorcerous Sundries that surely had the knowledge you needed... but what came of it?*
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale gazes off to the middistance (at nothing in particular) with a resolved expression.

7.speaker: Narrator
7.text: *Karsus himself was said to have forged such a crown, though you've never known it spoken of as anything but myth.*
7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale gazes off to the middistance (at nothing in particular) with a resolved expression.

6.speaker: Narrator
6.text: *The shelves at Sorcerous Sundries have been known to house the odd book on Netherese magic. It's time you made a return visit, to learn the truth about the crown, and what it could yet be capable of.*

2.speaker: Narrator
2.text: *The shelves at Sorcerous Sundries have been known to house the odd book on Netherese magic. It's time you paid them a visit, to learn the truth about the crown, and what it could yet be capable of.*
2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale gazes off to the middistance (at nothing in particular) with a resolved expression.

3.speaker: Narrator
3.text: *You should get some rest, but you simply can't. All you can think of is the brain that was beneath Moonrise Towers... and more importantly, what it was said to possess.*
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale stands in a corner of the camp by himself, deep in thought (arms crossed, chin propped up in one hand)
